answerText: Stanislaw Lem[10] Lem is far and away best known for this novel about Kris Kelvin, one of a team of scientists stationed in the namesake planet who are driven insane trying to contact the planet's sentient ocean.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | MIT A  | 20 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Frog Eggs" and "Lord of the Flies" are created by scientists from neutrino signal data in one of this author's novels. For 10 points each: [10] Name this author who wrote about the mathematician Peter Hogarth in His Master's Voice and echoed his most famous novel in a book in which the Hermes disastrously makes first contact with the Quintans, titled Fiasco.
